clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the prevention of itching associated with allergic conjunctivitis

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Epinastine is an antihistamine and an inhibitor of histamine release from the mast cell for topical administration to the eyes Epinastine is indicated for the prevention of itching associated with allergic conjunctivitis Epinastine is a topically active direct H sub 1 sub receptor antagonist and an inhibitor of the release of histamine from the mast cell Epinastine is selective for the histamine H sub 1 sub receptor and has affinity for the histamine H2 receptor Epinastine also possesses affinity for the a1 a2 and 5 HT sub 2 sub receptors Epinastine does not penetrate the blood brain barrier and therefore is not expected to induce side effects of the central nervous system
